intro: Cystopus brevistylis, commonly known as the narrow-styled cystopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Cystopus brevistylis is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
